page.title: 09Countryside and Ecology
page.content: In this area it is not difficult to escape from the residential areas to the countryside in a matter of minutes The parishes of Iwade and Bobbing are latticed with a maze of footpaths and these are kept open by the Swale Footpaths Group who regularly walk them to ensure they are kept open and not blocked. The closeness of the area to the estuary marshes of the Thames and Medway rivers provide a wide variety of bird life. Local farmers who keep weather records tell us that the rainfall of the area is below the national average, while the sunshine is more. In winter the area is hit by a biting easterly wind which blows in from the north sea. There is a claim that the area suffers from pollution from the smell eminating in Milton Creek, and the fumes from the car breaking plant at Ridham Dock.
